    • getRandomNumber

      public int getRandomNumber()
      Creates a random number for the randomly generated Part or Product IDs using the Random class.  The absolute value is used so that there are no negative id numbers.
      Returns:
      The random id number

    • productsAddButtonListener

      public void productsAddButtonListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws Exception
      Opens the Add Product Menu
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is fired when the Add Product button is clicked
      Throws:
      Exception - is thrown if the fxml file is not found

    • productsModifyButtonListener

      public void productsModifyButtonListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws Exception
      Opens the Modify Product Menu. It also passes the selectedProduct to the main Inventory class.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is fired when the Modify Product button is clicked
      Throws:
      Exception - is thrown if the fxml file is not found

      RUNTIME ERROR I was having trouble figuring out how to get the selectedProduct over to the modifyProduct controller. I ended up having to declare the ObservableLists as static variables in the Inventory class so that I could access them anywhere in the application.

    • productsDeleteButtonListener

      public void productsDeleteButtonListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes a Product from the productsTableView
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is fired when the delete product button is clicked

    • exitButtonListener

      public void exitButtonListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Closes the window and exits the program

    • partsSearchFieldListener

      public void partsSearchFieldListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Called when "Enter" is pressed when searching for a Part in the partsTableView . It selects the matching Part.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - fired when the user presses "Enter"

      RUNTIME ERROR I originally had the Error message-setting code in the initialize() function, and struggled with getting the error message to show up at the right time. I ended up having to move it to a separate function.

    • productsSearchFieldListener

      public void productsSearchFieldListener​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Called when "Enter" is pressed when searching for a Product in the productsTableView. It selects the matching Product.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - fired when the user presses "Enter"
